articles.title: "Mangyongdae Cup" sports game opens
articles.content:
"Mangyongdae Cup" sports game opens 
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The "Mangyongdae Cup" sports game opened on the threshold of Sun's Day.   The game takes place each year in Pyongyang and local areas around April 15, the birthday of the President Kim Il Sung, which brings together sports groups from across the country.   The participants will compete in nearly 50 events.   An opening ceremony was held at the Pyongyang indoor stadium on Friday.   Addressing the ceremony, Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Pak Myong Chol underscored the need to achieve fresh success in sports, too, this year, the year of turning-point in building a powerful nation and  thereby fully demonstrate the validity and vitality of the policy of the Worker's Party of Korea on physical culture and sports.

Photo exhibition and film show
articles.content:
Photo exhibition and film show
   Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition and a film show took place here on April 2 under the sponsorship of the Ministry of Foreign Trade to mark the 6th anniversary of the election of the General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the chairmanship of the DPRK National Defence Commission.   Present on invitation were foreign economic and trade councilors here.   Participants looked round photos of gifts foreign party and state leaders and personages of different strata sent to Kim Jong Il as token of unbounded respect and reverence for him, and appreciated the Korean documentary film "50th Anniversary of the DPRK."

articles.title: Frantic war exercise in S. Korea
articles.content:
Frantic war exercise in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The South Korean war hawks announced on April 1 that they would hire 30 T-38 planes for training  from the U.S. till the end of the year for war exercise of South Korea airforce pilots, a Seoul-based radio said.   They plan  to pay 86 million dollars for the hire.   They are stepping up war preparations, squandering a colossal amount of fund despite serious economic crisis, which triggers off complaints and protest among people.

Stamps issued to commemorate Sun's Day
articles.content:
Stamps issued to commemorate Sun's Day
   Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Stamps carrying a picture of the President Kim Il Sung and his old home in Mangyongdae were issued to commemorate the auspicious Sun's Day, April 15.   The picture of President Kim Il Sung is printed on a souvenir sheet.   In the center of the sheet decorated with magnolia patterns are his picture and letters "Sun's Day" and "The Great Leader President Kim Il Sung."   It was in August Juche 35 (1946), the period of building a new country, that the first stamp carrying the president's picture was issued in Korea.   This marked the beginning of the glorious history of issuing stamps with his picture and such stamps have since been issued one after another on national holidays and commemorative days including Sun's Day.   250 kinds of stamps carrying the president's picture were released and widely disseminated in more than 120 countries over the past 50 odd years.

S. Korean workers strike
articles.content:
S. Korean workers strike
   Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Bus Service Trade Unions went on a strike, in Taejon city, totally paralyzing public bus service on March 31 and April 1, a Seoul-based radio said.   The Taejon city branch of the "National Federation of Motor Car Worker's Unions" and the Taejon City Bus Service Trade Union went on a strike after their negotiations with the management over wage hike came to a rupture.   The unionists fought, not yielding to crackdown by the South Korean authorities and police.   The strike is likely to spread throughout South Korea with 14 city and provincial branches of the "National Federation of Motor Car Worker's Unions" planning to call a strike in solidarity with the strikers, said the radio.

Day of proclamation of Second Republic of Guinea greeted
articles.content:
Day of proclamation of Second Republic of Guinea greeted 
   Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson today dedicates a signed article to the 15th anniversary of the proclamation of the Second Republic of Guinea.   Noting that the Guinean people  have achieved national unity and big success in the struggle to develop the country's economy since the proclamation of the Second Republic, the paper stresses the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over their achievements.   The DPRK and Guinea have developed the friendly and cooperative relations in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the paper says, and goes on:   The Korean people express the belief that the friendly relations between the two peoples will  grow stronger and wish the Guinean people greater success in their efforts for the independent  development of the country.

Greetings to Senegalese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Senegalese President
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Senegalese President Abdou Diouf on April 2 on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of its independence.   Expressing the hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the Senegalese president and people bigger success in the work for the prosperity of the country and the building of a new society.

articles.title: Chongryon first vice-chairman arrives
articles.content:
Chongryon first vice-chairman arrives
   Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly So Man Sul, first vice-chairman of the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), arrived here today to visit the socialist homeland to mark the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung and to participate in the second session of the 10th SPA of the DPRK.   He was greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Sun and Kim Su Ik, director of the bureau of reception for overseas compatriots.
